title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The U.S. economy grew rapidly in the fourth quarter, advancing to a 6.9% annual rate and capping the strongest year of growth in nearly four decades. But the economy recently has run into obstacles that could lead to more modest expansion this year, economists said.

---

Apple posted quarterly result that shattered previous records, answering the concerns of jittery investors about the toll from supply-chain constraints.

---

U.S. stocks fell in another frenzied session, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 0.5%, 1.4% and 0.02%, respectively.

---

Diageo, the world's largest spirits maker, said soaring pandemic demand is depleting stocks of some of its bestselling brands.

---

A U.S. appeals court reversed the convictions of two former Deutsche Bank traders who were found guilty of rigging Libor.

---

Robinhood shares fell as much as 12% in after-hours trading after the firm reported a loss of $423 million for the fourth quarter.

---

McDonald's said it expects the rate of cost increases for food, paper and other materials in the U.S. to roughly double this year compared with 2021's pace.

---

Biogen is selling its share in biosimilar joint venture Samsung Bioepis for at least $2.25 billion to partner Samsung Biologics.

---

Home Depot named operating chief Ted Decker to succeed Craig Menear as CEO.
